TitleText: 1	The Chemical Wedding by Christian Rosencreutz
2	A ROMANCE IN EIGHT DAYS by JOHANN VALENTIN ANDREAE in a new version by JOHN CROWLEY

37	It was just before Easter Sunday , 1
38	and I was sitting at my table .
40	talking a long time as usual with my Maker
41	and thinking about some of the great mysteries
42	the Father of Lights had revealed to me .
43	Now I was ready to make and to bake
46	to eat with my beloved Paschal Lamb .
47	All of a sudden a terrible wind blew up , so strong
50	my little house was built on
52	but I ’d seen the Devil do things as bad as this before
53	( the Devil had often tried to harm me ) ,
56	Till I felt somebody touch me on the back .
58	so that I did n’t dare turn .
59	I tried to stay as brave and calm
60	as a human being could under the circumstances .
64	and at last I looked around .
65	A woman stood there , so bright and beautiful , in a sky - colored robe – a heavens covered with
66	1 Christian ’s story begins just before Easter , like Dante ’s Divine Comedy .
67	It can be seen as an allegory of Christ ’s death and resurrection ,
68	though this idea produces some puzzles .
70	the young deer skipped so happily ,
71	that it gladdened my old heart ,
72	and I could n't help singing too ...
74	I was awake and lying in bed next morning ,
75	looking idly at the wonderful images and inscriptions all around my room ,
76	when suddenly I heard the sound of trumpets ,
77	as if a procession were already underway .
78	My page jumped out of bed
84	“ They 're already being presented to the king ! "
85	I could only groan in frustration and curse my lazy bones .
89	and ran out of the chamber
92	and gave me the good news
93	that I actually had n’t overslept ;
97	they had n’t wanted to wake an old man
99	But now I had to get ready
100	to go with him to the lion fountain ,
101	where most of the others were gathered .
105	as soon as I had got into my habit ,
106	I followed him to the garden
108	I found that the lion , in place of his sword , now held a rather large plaque .
111	that it had been taken from those ancient monuments
113	and put here for some special reason .
114	The inscription on it was fading away ,
115	so I should set it down here
117	and ask my readers to ponder it :
119	Now after humankind has suffered so much harm here
121	having by god ’s counsel and with the help of art become a healing balm .
